section.title: Introduction
section.para: Header translation is the process of converting the one header name to a new header name or to multiple new header names without changing the functionality of the request. The Header Translation filter performs this process.

section.title: Header Translation Request Prerequisites
section.para: The Header Translation filter has no request prerequisites.

section.title: Header Translation Configuration Options
section.para: The Header Translation filter can be configured by editing the header-translation.cfg.xmlfile. The filter can be added to the Repose deployment through the System Model Configuration. The user can edit the following element:

para.guilabel: Elements and Attributes Used in the Header Translation Filter

listitem.para: This attribute contains the name of an already present header that you want to translate. The header is evaluated in a case-sensitive manner. Each <header> element must have a unique value for the <original-name> attribute.
This attribute contains a space-delimited list of names that you would like the <original-name> translated into.
This attribute removes the original headers. The default value is set to false.

section.title: Header Translation Process

listitem.para: When a request enters the Header Translation filter, it will look for any header names that match the <original-name> attribute of the <header> element.

If a request has a header that matches the value of an <original-header> attribute in the filter, then the filter adds headers to the request that correspond to the value or values in the <new-name> attribute.
If the <remove-original> attribute is set to false, the request retains the original header so that the request is sent to the origin service with the original header and the new header or headers.
If the <remove-original> attribute is set to true, the request is sent with just the new headers.

figure.title: Request/Response Lifecycle for the Header Translation Filter

listitem.para: The Header Translation filter will never return an error code. The request will simply pass through to the next filter or the origin service.

If the header to be translated is not included in the request, the header is ignored, and the request is passed through to the origin service. The filter does not expect the header to be present every time.
